fsb_rpt.page: The app is called Waitless and it's designed for helping people get a seat for a restaurant which doesn't take reservations so that they don't need to be arrived and wait for 45 minutes. If you always have dinner outside in Boston, you may find this situation very common. This new app is going to short the waiting time. After the customer downloads this app on their phones and the restaurant also has this app downloaded on their device, the time saving trip is started. Customers can start to wait in the list when they heading to the place and they can see the waiting time so that customers can check the time and decide which place they want to go. It's similar with using Google Map to check the route and the app will tell the customers that how long it will take for them to get there and how long the waiting time is. Waitless is a combination of Google Map, Yelp and waiting time of all the restaurants. Also, it can make the points card electronical too.

page.app_ovr: Currently, people need to go to the restaurant first, get in a line if it’s busy there, and wait until your turn. Since there won’t be enough space for customers to wait inside the restaurant, customers will have to wait outside. In Boston, the winter is cold and long which is up to 6 months of a year. Therefore, by possibility, there will be 50% of times that a customer waits for food is going to be in the cold winter. Some of the restaurants call by name which means the customer can’t leave. Some of restaurants use the “buzz thing” to let customers know their turn but they can’t stay too far from the restaurant.

After installing Waitless, all these problems solved! No need for waiting outside in the wind for a long time and you can plan your time for your meal. Besides, you don’t need to remember to carry all the points cards with you or get more points cards if you didn’t bring your own.

page.fsb_hlgt: In order to develop an app like this, we need to understand how does a restaurant calculate the time. Also, the other problem is that how can we make everything live. Making the points card electronic is the easy part, as long as the restaurant has some kind of points card. A good way to develop the calculating the time is that every restaurant has its own average of dinning time for every numbers of party. As long as we have the average, it will be easy to calculate time. The app is a live based app which means it will sync the changes at backend every few seconds.

Sometimes the cost of developing a software can be huge like Windows10. Sometimes it can be small, for example, the coast of developing Flappy Bird is tinny where it only needs one developer to code on the IOS platform. What this app will do is not only saving time for customers but also saving time for parking spots. Suppose, the average time for a meal is 40 minutes, after the customer using this app, customer should only use the parking spot for at most 1 hour instead of 1.5 hour now.

page.req_sect: Equipments Needs usable computers with required software installed. The computers need IOS Xcode installed and Java access. Xcode is for the IOS app design and Java is for the Android.

page.est: $5000 for attorney to get the app licence and patent
$5000 for paying the computer developers to develop the code

page.tmln: Get the idea and find people to work with

fsb_rpt.page: The risk of this app is the lack of users. The way to avoid it is to send advertisements in popular restaurants around Boston. The app is free first 6-months to restaurants so that they will get to know it well and starting using it.

page.fnc: The cost of developing the IOS app is the cost of human. It may need 3 person to get all these done. One for the GUI design for the customer side, one for GUI design for the restaurant side and the last one is to get all the data from customer and restaurants. There will be no more cost other than people. Thus, developing a software doesn't need huge funds.

page.fsb: This app is a feasible application. According to the design, this app should be capable on IOS and Android which are the two most popular operating system on phones.
page.cond: On the restaurant side, most of them have one device to take waiting list, other wise, it needs a person to count the tables and calculate the time. If we can make it as a app, things are going to be a lot much easier. On the customer side, with this app, it will save a lot of time. Instead of waiting outside the restaurant in the cold freezing weather, it's better to have an app like this to get on the waiting list before you arrive.
page.sum: The Waitless will give both customers and restaurants convenience and help them save time. There is an old saying: "Time is gold." Thus, saving time is the same as saving money which is the core idea of the Waitless app.

report.p: This draft feasibility report describes an app called Waitless, which shows potential restaurant patrons wait times at various restaurants. In the report, conforming to the genre, is evidence that the development of the app is feasible.

A feasibility report is a paper written to explain and show why it is possible that a project or idea can be made into reality. The feasibility of the project is displayed via data or other logical evidence. The situation described is very appropriate to the genre and the situation is clearly presented.

For the most part, the sentence structure and word choice are genre appropriate. A potential problem that I noted was extensive use of pronouns such as "we" and "you". The problem with these pronouns is that a feasibility report is meant to present evidence in a formal fashion; these pronouns make the paper seem too casual. My advice to remedy this would be to replace, where appropriate, replace the pronouns with something less direct, e.g., "one". It should be noted that it is appropriate to use "we" when referring to the team developing the app. Another note, regarding word choice, more technical jargon could be used. This could be necessary to explain in a more in depth fashion how the back-end of the app functions, how the app works, and how specifically development will take place.

The rules of the schema are mostly followed well. One noticeable exception is in the table of contents where the "n" and "lvl" attributes are not used. Another location where the schema isn't followed exactly, is in the report page, the timeline elements are missing "n" attributes. These "n" attributes are not shown to be required in Oxygen, but our schema documentation shows them as required.
